ygData.subject: Re: Playing a Troll Warrior
ygData.msgSnippet: The zone is South Ro.  I remember when those orcs scared the hell out of me my first trip to inothule and ferrot, they were red, then yellow, then blue and now
ygData.messageBody:
The zone is South Ro. I remember when those orcs scared the hell out of me
my first trip to inothule and ferrot, they were red, then yellow, then blue
and now REALLY green. Just for fun I run straight through the camps now :).

> ----------
> From: schlaban yocksovik[SMTP:anonymaste@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Wednesday, May 19, 1999 11:24 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Playing a Troll Warrior
>
> From: "schlaban yocksovik" <anonymaste@...>
>
> well I havent played a troll warrior but I am playing a barbarian warrior
> and I have played a troll SW.
>
> bash bash bash. bashin es whad trolls do an they reeeli gud tu.
>
> I dont know about any warrior quests but check out the SW guildmaster, he
> might know.
> Go out in the swamp and stay close to the guards in the beginning.
> remember that water moccasins are poisenus and kinda annoying, there are
> better things to kill. Get the regular newbie mobs like skells and stuff.
> As
> you are a warrior wack white and yellow stuff in the beginning. Just
> remember to stay close to the guards.
> When you feel a bit more sure about yerself follow the steady stream of
> people to the island in the middle of the swamp (its kinda hard to find in
>
> the beginning)
>
> There are plenty of froglocks there to bash. Bet keep in mind that they
> help
> eachother and the situation can easily get outofhand.
> there are several different frogloks and some are harder the others. If I
> remember it correctly its froglok, froglok fishermen, froglok foragers.
>
> They also have armor sometimes.
>
> At level 7 as sw, prolly level 5 or 6 as warrior you can starta a team and
>
> pull some orcs from the zone just opposite the town.
> Sorry I dont remember the name but its realy easy to find.
>
> well thats all I can come up with atm.
>
> well there is guk dungeon too but I dont know if its worth going there
> when
> you start up, there is some realy NASTY stuff inthere and trains can be
> painfull at times.
>
> Not a good guide but I hope it will give you some poiters and ideas.
>
> Vashi
>
> >From: "Bryan Hinkel" <bjhinkel@...>
> >
> >Hail Great and learned warriors. I have decided to start playing a Troll
> >Warrior and would like some advice. All I know now is to grab the first
> >two
> >handed sword I can find and start killing everything in site. Any
> >suggestions on how to play the largest evil killing machine in Norrath?
> >
> >Eyebeebad
> >Troll Warrior of the 1st Rank
> >Bristlebane
